reviews.text: I have stayed in many hostels and this one was awesome. The staff was friendly and helpful. They had numerous activities you could do on your stay. I chose to see a tango show. Many friendly people there. In a descent location. Big buffet breakfast, and comfortable rooms.
reviews.title: Impressed

reviews.text: Suggestion stay on a Weekend then you can get access to all the clubs and on sundays there is a craft antique market 10 mins away ... Worth checking out!
reviews.title: Professional, if slightly overpriced

reviews.text: In many ways this place is perfect - beautifully decorated, well-designed, clean, professional, and fun to stay in. The quality of rooms is more like a hotel than a hostel, there's an amazing empanada place round the corner and the location in San Telmo is great. I would say, however, that it is rather expensive, and avoid the 'all you can eat' barbecue - a couple of pieces of meat and don't ask for more! Would recommend the On The Road hostel in Palermo above this one, as it has much more character and charm.
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.text: I stayed in America del Sur Hostel with my mom and my brother for two nights. This hostel is more like a hotel then a typical hostel. It was a great place to be with my family. Although we did not stay over the weekend so I am not sure how the atmosphere changes when they have their pre-game party. The breakfast is GREAT! Definitely the best breakfast in a hostel I have had in Argentina/Chile/Uruguay. The rooms are very comfortable and there is a lot of places to hangout within the hostel. The staff is very friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend this hostel to others.
reviews.title: Very good choice in BA

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hostel located in San Telmo district, and is walking distance to many greate places in BA. We stayed there in double room with bathroom. Clean, cosy and comfortable. The staff is extremely welcoming and helpful. Breakfast is included. Common area is large and you can relax there. WiFi everywhere :)
reviews.title: Great hostel to meet people

reviews.text: I liked it somuch i booked another night :)
reviews.title: Nice atmosphere and clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Its central located to the city centre.
reviews.title: Fantastic location and staff!

reviews.text: The dorms are very clean.. Good comfortable bed.
reviews.title: Good hostel near San Telmo

reviews.text: The staff makes you feel comfortable. Giving advice about buses, tours etc.
reviews.title: Good but noisy

reviews.text: Nice social/chillout room.
reviews.title: BA for 10 days-solo female

reviews.text: This is a really friendly and clean hostel. The communal areas are nicer than the dorms (we stayed in a twin room), but the rooms are fine. Clean and air conditioned. The atmosphere is relaxed and the staff are really helpful. Wifi was good. Breakfast was good. The hostel is in a bit of a dodgy part of town, but every where is accessible and is two females travelling on our own, we didn't once feel unsafe. Couldn't recommend it enough!
reviews.title: A fabulous place to stay

reviews.text: The Hostel "America del Sur" ist situated directly in the lively area of San Telmo, near to the city center of Buenos Aires! If you need an inexpensive place to stay there, it is one of the best opportunities.
reviews.title: Very Good for your Stay in Buenos Aires!

reviews.text: We had a dorm with three beds, but the occupancy was kept down to three, so that we had a private room. The room was very clean and in good conditions. It was cleaned up every day. The private shower and the private toilet was modern and also very clean. Of course, the hostel offers no luxury, but especially for a backpacker tour, it is totally adequate.
reviews.title: Great free city tours

reviews.text: The staff is very friendly and everybody at the front desk speaks English fluently. They tried to make everything possible, what we asked for.
reviews.title: Best in town!

reviews.text: The breakfast was good and it is very nice to get it together with all the international guests in the hotel restaurant or (even better) the atrium. Beside, the Hostel offers a lot of activities like Tango courses or free walking tours. WiFi is also for free.
reviews.title: Wish i was there still!

reviews.text: It's true -- this hostel feels more like a hotel than a hostel. They make your bed nice and tidy each day. The breakfast is generous by Argentina standards, including juice, yogurt, several cakes and nice bread. Staff is beyond polite and professional -- at the same time -- and somehow remember your name in a large hostel. Wifi is good and fast.
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable, good value

reviews.text: Location? It's ideally situated in what I consider to be the best neighborhood in Buenos Aires for tourists to stay -- San Telmo. Lots of quirky bars and restaurants, as well as a massive Sunday market with great shopping, eats and atmosphere. Three blocks from the Subte. Walking distance to the center and government buildings. Palermo, though, is a good 30 minute Subte ride or 10 minute taxi, if you plan on enjoying that scenery quite frequently.
reviews.title: Hotel or Hostel?

reviews.text: Dorms are never really locked -- well, if someone is inside the dorm you can't lock the door -- and this could annoy some paranoid travelers. An easy solution would be for the hostel to switch to a magnetic keycard system (providing one key for each dorm guest) and get rid of those incredibly annoying skeleton keys that bizarrely seem to plague Argentina.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: All in all, this is an outstanding choice for those who want a clean, comfortable and friendly base to explore a great city. The only people for who it might not serve well are those looking for a hostel with a bit more historic charm (this is a decidedly modern facility reminiscent of an Ikea store) or those desiring for a smaller, more intimate accommodation. For everyone else, it's a great place!
reviews.title: A great place to stay!

reviews.text: Let me say that this property puts most hotels to shame. The service was unbelievable and the cleanliness is unparalleled. However, with all of this high-touch management, the space is a bit white-washed and doesn't lend itself toward much guest interaction. If you are traveling alone, you may want to try another hostel, but if you need a nice respite, this is the place.
reviews.title: Great staff, spacious and clean!
